release_notes.en-US: Hotfix for disappearing Inbox contents

* Hotfix
* Disable Public Folder support
Hotfix
* Hotfix

- Supports Thunderbird 78
- Support Shared Mailboxes
- Support DSN

* Feature: tags/keywords
* Calendar: Fix timezone, for repeat events spanning summer time change
* Calendar: Fix invite response
* Calendar: Fix Listener is undefined
* Login: Warn that custom cookie preferences cause "Login expired"
* Login: Better checks that login is finished
* Login: Better error message on wrong password
* Login: Hotmail: Keep me signed in
* EWS: Support GAL
* EWS: Fix folder creation
* Exchange 2013: Fix automatic mail check
* Exchange 2010: Fix copying messages to Exchange account
Fixed small bugs in calendar, e.g. when creating events (still in beta)

- Offer Hotmail users to migrate to IMAP. It was a bug that they were offered Owl.
- Calendar fixes
- Only show Internet email addresses in address book, not X500 addresses

New features:
* Calendar support
* EWS only: Push mail

Bug fixes:
* Prompt for password, if none is stored
- Office365: Further fix for unwanted SMTP server.

- EWS: Beta for calendar using EWS protocol - EWS: Make contacts writable - EWS: Work around invalid XML sent by Exchange server for messages with strange characters - Collect email addresses when sending - Office365: Remove accidentally configured SMTP server - Fix for outlook.com live.com Hotmail personal accounts, after Microsoft server breakage - Show errors during license fetch - Fix license notification in TB 68 - Other bug fixes

* 0.6.8.4 was a hotfix to work around a ArgumentNullException bug caused by Microsoft on their Office365 login servers.
* Unfortunately, that hotfix broke on-premise Exchange login pages, affecting many other users.
* This is a more specific workaround that applies only to Office365 servers.
- Microsoft broke Office365. This is a workaround.
- Automatically sign in to Office365 and outlook.com (frequent user request) - Update Sent folder after sending mail - Encryption: Beta level support (no guarantees)

- Fix drafts and copy of messages from other accounts to Exchange. This used to work and was broken by a change by Microsoft in Office365. Now fixed.
- When switching folders, quickly check with the server whether there's new mail in that folder
- EWS: Fix mail fetch aborting due to a single faulty message

Hero: Craig. Thank you!

New features:
- Support Exchange 2010

Bug fixes:
- Allow messages to be deleted that exist locally but are already deleted on the server.
- Disable folder compaction, to allow automatic compaction of other accounts.
- Adapt to TB 69 (development branch), which broke us. Now fixed.

- Mail filters that move messages broke mail fetch in 0.6.7.1.
- Fix signatures with images
- EWS send folder
- Adapt to some Thunderbird 69 changes

* Fix save sent mail in EWS
* Fix threading with some invalid References headers
* Fix concurrency limits regressed in last version

* Fix some users not getting new mail anymore
* Allow Owl servers to be set as default
* Fix some folders with accents, umlauts, diacritics etc.
* Internal code changes
* Fix typo that broke 0.6.5.7

* Check all folders for new message counts. (OWA and EWS)
* You still need to click on the folder for the messages to be fetched, but at least the message counts for the folders should be updated, so you see which folder has new mail.

* Automatically re-login after expired login, esp. for Office365 users
* More reliable initial folder fetch in face of errors

* Detect an expired login of Office365
* GAL disabled by default, because it's huge and causing TB to freeze
* Other bug fixes
Reduce concurrent server calls.
Add error logging to server

- Attachments bug should be mostly fixed now
- You first see a preliminary version (shows "Downloading: <filename>"), while we're downloading the attachments.

In addition to the extensive changes in 0.6:
* French translation
* Dutch translation
* Fix bug where copying several messages to Local Folders would lose exactly 1 message. Does not happen when copying between Exchange folders, only when copying to Local Folders or POP3 accounts.
* Report server errors that happen during sending mail

Major bug fixes and speed improvements.

Features:
* Attachments: Show when the Exchange server deliberately blocks an attachment due to its file type, per administrator policy setting
* Show folders that are not children of the inbox

Performance:
* When opening a folder for the first time, now show the headers roughly 100 times faster
* When downloading message data, adapt number of parallel calls to server limits
* Improve performance of contact resync

Big fixes:
* Detect logout situation better
* Better error logging on Error Console (Ctrl-Shift-J)
* Refactor license logic code
* Detect when creating 2 OWA accounts at the same server and prevent it

* Fixes critical security issue. Exposure is very limited, because JavaScript is disabled, so there is no known way to cause actual harm with this bug, but just in case there's a way to exploit this, we ship this fix.
* Now blocks remote images as expected
